results.headline: A Backstage Genius at Bennington and Juilliard
results.summary_short: Greg Vander Veer’s “Miss Hill: Making Dance Matter” is a documentary about Martha Hill, an educator whose influence may have been as great as any of the dance world’s better-known names.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Miss Hill: Making Dance Matter

results.headline: Sparring in the Boxing Ring, in Politics and in Life
results.summary_short: The documentary “Manny” is the story of Manny Pacquiao, a tiny Filipino boxer who emerged as a champion, a congressman and a natural showman.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Manny

results.headline: Brothers and Rivals in Gore
results.summary_short: “Killers,” by the Mo Brothers, has a nihilistic yet mournful tone, following two murderers, one Japanese and one Indonesian.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Killers

results.headline: Raging Against the Dying of the Stage Lights
results.summary_short: Al Pacino plays a revered stage and screen actor who fears he is losing his mojo in “The Humbling.”

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Humbling

results.headline: Spilling a Love Potion on a Fairy Princess
results.summary_short: Gary Rydstrom’s animated “Strange Magic” is based on a story by George Lucas inspired by “A Midsummer Night’s Dream” and populated with fairies, elves and goblins.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Strange Magic

results.headline: The Grief Spread Across the Road to Recovery
results.summary_short: Jennifer Aniston plays a woman recovering from a horrific accident in “Cake,” a drama directed by Daniel Barnz.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Cake

results.headline: A Rum Crew Jettisons All Reason
results.summary_short: In “Black Sea,” Jude Law stars as a sailor who seizes on a chance to explore for undersea gold with a rough and greedy crew.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Black Sea

results.headline: Music as a Balm for a Grieving Soul
results.summary_short: “Song One,” starring Anne Hathaway, offers a wispy meditation on the healing properties of a pretty folk song — especially when sung by a sensitive troubadour with bedroom eyes.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Song One

results.headline: Jockeying to Get Ahead by Cutting Corners
results.summary_short: “Americons,” based on Beau Martin Williams’s personal experience, is a morality tale of high-flying, unscrupulous lenders.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Americons

results.headline: Unshackled Hacker Dons a White Hat
results.summary_short: In Michael Mann’s “Blackhat,” a hacker is provisionally released from prison to combat a cybercriminal who has sabotaged a nuclear plant and manipulated a financial market.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Blackhat

results.headline: A Family of Few Words in a Slow-Burn Disaster
results.summary_short: In “Medeas,” Andrea Pallaoro depicts a troubled farm family on the verge of imploding.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Medeas

results.headline: A Designated Mourner, Flirting Warily With Joy
results.summary_short: In Uberto Pasolini’s “Still Life,” Eddie Marsan plays a Londoner who arranges for the burial of dead people whose bodies have not been claimed by relatives.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Still Life

results.headline: Adventures of a Peruvian Immigrant (the Furry Variety)
results.summary_short: The beloved bear of children’s books makes his big-screen debut in Paul King’s “Paddington.”

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Paddington

results.headline: An Education on Camera and Behind It
results.summary_short: College students helped make “Northern Borders,” a coming-of-age film set in Vermont.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Northern Borders

results.headline: Working on a Screenplay, One Distraction at a Time
results.summary_short: “Loitering With Intent” follows two New York actors as they struggle to write a film script that they have already boasted about to a producer.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Loitering With Intent

results.headline: A Mining Tragedy, With Veins of Earnest Drama
results.summary_short: A calamity shatters the peace of a West Virginia mining town in “Little Accidents,” with Jacob Lofland, Chloë Sevigny and Boyd Holbrook.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Little Accidents

results.headline: A Family Bond Inspired by Music and Circumstance
results.summary_short: “Life Inside Out” chronicles a mother-son musical partnership that grows from a family’s financial hardships.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Life Inside Out

results.headline: Have Tux, Will Babysit Groom
results.summary_short: In “The Wedding Ringer,” a comedy directed by Jeremy Garelick, Kevin Hart plays a professional best man for grooms who lack friends.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Wedding Ringer

results.headline: Contrapuntal Hum of a Worker’s Hive
results.summary_short: Denis Côté’s semi-documentary “Joy of Man’s Desiring” captures the humanity of factory workers as they encounter frustrations and the occasional moment of satisfaction.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Que ta joie demeure

results.headline: All for One and One Robot From All
results.summary_short: In “Spare Parts,” George Lopez and Jamie Lee Curtis play educators who help four Mexican students build an underwater robot in a national competition.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Spare Parts
